title: How to Get an ASIN Number on Amazon & Make Your Own

steps.title: Do a search to see if your product already has an ASIN.
steps.content: Do a search to see if your product already has an ASIN. Be thorough in your search. There are websites out there to help you with that. Search for 'ASIN tools' or 'ASIN conversion'.

steps.title: Go to your Amazon Seller Central page and then select Inventory >> Add a Product.
steps.content: Go to your Amazon Seller Central page and then select Inventory >> Add a Product. That will bring you to the page that will help you determine if Amazon has it.

steps.title: Type in whatever information that you have.
steps.content: Type in whatever information that you have. The UPC is usually the best. If you don't see the UPC, try describing it in various ways.

steps.title: Rejoice if the search yields a product.
steps.content: Rejoice if the search yields a product. You don't have to get an ASIN for it.

steps.title: Click on See all product details.
steps.content: Click on See all product details . This will take you to the Amazon page for that product. On that page, you will see the ASIN. The ASIN is the 'number' that starts with B00 .

steps.title: Select Create a new product, if Amazon doesn't already have your particular item.
steps.content: Select Create a new product , if Amazon doesn't already have your particular item.

steps.title: Obtain some UPC codes for your product.
steps.content: Obtain some UPC codes for your product. It will need to have the UPC code before it is assigned an ASIN.

steps.title: Upload the product with its brand new UPC code and Amazon will then assign it an ASIN.
steps.content: Upload the product with its brand new UPC code and Amazon will then assign it an ASIN.
